meanings.sent1: She resculpted the clay pot to make it taller.
meanings.sent2: The artist resculpted the statue to fix a mistake.
meanings.sent3: After a mishap, she resculpted the cake into a new design.
meanings.sent4: His words resculpted her perception of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's hands resculpted the marble with precision.

meanings.definition: To alter or change the form or structure of (something) through sculpting again
meanings.sent1: They resculpted the landscape to create a more natural look.
meanings.sent2: The architect resculpted the building's design for better functionality.
meanings.sent3: The chef resculpted the mashed potatoes into a funny shape.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness resculpted his hardened heart.
meanings.sent5: The storm resculpted the coastline, leaving a new shape behind.
